Questions.Question: Who played the character Marty McFly in the 'Back to the Future' movies?
Questions.Explanation: Michael J. Fox portrayed the iconic character Marty McFly in the 'Back to the Future' film series.

Questions.Question: Which band released the hit song 'Sweet Child o' Mine' in the 80s?
Questions.Explanation: Guns N' Roses, an American rock band, released the popular song 'Sweet Child o' Mine' in 1987.

Questions.Question: What was the name of the fictional town in the TV show 'Stranger Things'?
Questions.Explanation: The TV show 'Stranger Things' is set in the fictional town of Hawkins, Indiana.

Questions.Question: Which actor played the role of Indiana Jones in the 'Indiana Jones' movies?
Questions.Explanation: Harrison Ford portrayed the adventurous archaeologist Indiana Jones in the film series.

Questions.Question: What was the name of the main character in the TV show 'The A-Team'?
Questions.Explanation: The main character in the TV show 'The A-Team' was Colonel John 'Hannibal' Smith.

Questions.Question: Which movie featured the iconic line 'I'll be back'?
Questions.Explanation: The line 'I'll be back' became famous from the movie 'The Terminator' starring Arnold Schwarzenegger.

Questions.Question: Who was the lead singer of the band Queen?
Questions.Explanation: Freddie Mercury was the lead vocalist of the British rock band Queen.

Questions.Question: Which TV show featured a group of teenagers solving mysteries in a van called the Mystery Machine?
Questions.Explanation: The TV show 'Scooby-Doo' followed a group of teenagers and their dog solving mysteries.

Questions.Question: What was the name of the fictional high school in the movie 'The Breakfast Club'?
Questions.Explanation: The fictional high school in the movie 'The Breakfast Club' was called Shermer High School.

Questions.Question: Which actor played the character John McClane in the 'Die Hard' movies?
Questions.Explanation: Bruce Willis portrayed the tough cop John McClane in the 'Die Hard' film series.

Questions.Question: What was the name of the robot in the movie 'Short Circuit'?
Questions.Explanation: The robot in the movie 'Short Circuit' was named Johnny 5.

Questions.Question: Which band released the hit song 'Livin' on a Prayer' in the 80s?
Questions.Explanation: Bon Jovi, an American rock band, released the popular song 'Livin' on a Prayer' in 1986.

Questions.Question: Who was the main antagonist in the movie 'Ghostbusters'?
Questions.Explanation: Gozer was the main antagonist in the movie 'Ghostbusters', appearing as a powerful deity.

Questions.Question: Which TV show featured a group of friends hanging out at a diner called The Max?
Questions.Explanation: The TV show 'Saved by the Bell' revolved around a group of friends at Bayside High School.

Questions.Question: What was the name of the fictional town in the TV show 'Twin Peaks'?
Questions.Explanation: The TV show 'Twin Peaks' was set in the fictional town of Twin Peaks, Washington.

Questions.Question: Which actor played the character Ferris Bueller in the movie 'Ferris Bueller's Day Off'?
Questions.Explanation: Matthew Broderick portrayed the mischievous teenager Ferris Bueller in the movie.

Questions.Question: What was the name of the fictional high school in the TV show 'Beverly Hills, 90210'?
Questions.Explanation: The fictional high school in the TV show 'Beverly Hills, 90210' was called West Beverly High School.

Questions.Question: Which movie featured the iconic line 'Say hello to my little friend'?
Questions.Explanation: The line 'Say hello to my little friend' is from the movie 'Scarface' starring Al Pacino.

Questions.Question: Who was the main villain in the movie 'The Karate Kid'?
Questions.Explanation: Johnny Lawrence, a member of the Cobra Kai dojo, was the main antagonist in 'The Karate Kid'.

Questions.Question: Which band released the hit song 'Every Breath You Take' in the 80s?
Questions.Explanation: The Police, an English rock band, released the popular song 'Every Breath You Take' in 1983.
